main event: An observer reported seeing a large, lighted object resembling a balloon over New Orleans, LA on March 3, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as round and approximately 40 feet in diameter., It was observed for 3 minutes between 9:40 PM and 10:00 PM CST., The object traveled horizontally over a distance of approximately 2 miles., The object emitted a very bright white light from its circumference without any apparent flashing or blinking., The sighting occurred under clear weather conditions with bright starlight.
witness description: Observer was standing near the main entrance gate of Naval Air Station.
